page.title: 01THWAITES, AN OVERVIEW
page.content: Our Domesday area is a rural one, the main use of land being connected with farming. However this doesn't employ many people. The land is mainly pasture, with quite a lot of rough pasture and mixed woodland. There is a low density of population. We estimate that there are less than 500 people living in our area. Probably because of the low population there are very few amenities. Our area is bordered to the west by the Duddon Estuary. The land is quite hilly, rising from sea level to 174 metres above. Just over half of the working population travel five miles or less to work.Many work in Millom,our nearest small town about three miles away. There is no one predominant employer either in Millom or for those who travel further afield For the purpose of our survey we are referring to the area as "Thwaites".
